questions.question: She is prettier ……………………. anybody I know.
questions.description: Better is a comparative word. It is followed by than.

questions.question: I have hardly done ………………………… since morning.
questions.description: Hardly is a negative word. It cannot be used with nothing.

questions.question: I have …………………………. met any film stars.
questions.description: Never is used in affirmative sentences.

questions.question: It is difficult to understand ………………………… she says or does.
questions.description: Non-assertive words like anybody and anything are mainly used with words expressing a negative kind of meaning.

questions.question: The pilots went on strike, but …………………………… the air hostesses.
questions.description: To make a word, expression or clause negative, we use not.

questions.question: …………………………… you say, I will not believe you.
Call me when you arrive, ………………………………. late it is.
She is ……………………….. a great artist than I am.
It takes ……………………………. to get used to driving in the city.
You look ………………………….. What happened?
questions.description: Look is a copular verb. It is modified by an adjective.
